article.headline: Canisius 80, St. Bonaventure 70
article.story: BUFFALO, N.Y. -- Julius Coles scored 21 points and Gaby Belardo added a career-high 19 as Canisius rallied to defeat St. Bonaventure 80-70 on Friday night in the season opener for both teams. The Bonnies jumped out to a 13-6 lead, but a Greg Logins layup gave the Golden Griffins a 22-21 lead with 7:17 to go and Canisius never trailed again. The Golden Griffins, who shot 53.3 percent in the first half (16 of 30) pulled ahead 37-33 at halftime and led by as many as 13 with 2:01 to go. Andrew Nicholson scored 23 points for St. Bonaventure of 8-of-12 shooting and Michael Davenport added 19. Canisius shot 50 percent from the floor for the game (25 of 50) while the Bonnies shot 49.1 percent (26 of 53). Alshwan Hymes had a career-high 13 points for the Golden Griffins on 5-of-6 shooting. Canisius finished with a 33-27 advantage on the boards.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
